I decided to give it a little more just in case there was at least something. Episode 22: Nothing. Art and music were the only aspects that I enjoyed.
This show is not worth watching. I gave it 22 episodes.I can not find the motivation to finish the last four.

I enjoyed reading the wiki page more than I did watching the anime lel.
The anime really needed to work on it's explaining because the theory is actually very interesting! It explains how magic is used, why CADs are needed, why the MC is OP yet is ranked lowly as a magician etc.
If you want to watch this anime I highly recommend checking this out as a starting point http://anime.stackexchange.com/questions/23635/what-actually-is-modern-magic-and-how-does-it-work
Honestly, I wasn't that interested in the plot but I must say, the action scenes were seriously badass and the animation is superb. 
Reading the theory definitely made watching the anime a better experience so I giveit a 7/10

You know I've been watching a hella lot of anime, many kinds, many genre. To be honest the characters suck in this anime, but that isn't what makes or breaks a story. I mean if everything else was average then this anime would have no redeeming features, but it creates a setting, background intrigue and a lattice of interrelationships on multiple levels and does it fairly well to form a story not about Tatsuya and Miyuki, but about how a world of magic doesn't just make it about saving princesses or fighting a single bad organization with one side good the other evil. Rather thereis no good side only the lesser of two evils. Take the first villain of the story Blanche, their  agenda was normal people fighting against elitism of magicians, which really turned out to be just a political play from another country, in the end elitism and national safety won against equality and foreign interference (I think that was a really indirect jab at America but I can't say).

Then the next one was about establishing how magic was used and opening a darker plot of Boosters (experimentation and torture of magicians to make killing weapons, kind of glazed over it a little) vs enjoyment and fun of magic (NSC). They also tossed in lineage and skill vs technological back up and planning. 

Lastly we have the Theoretical Competition where it is just about freedom of information vs safety and finally how magic works in realistic combat (I don't think the fight scenes were that great though).


The art I liked the characters weren't over the top with spikey hair, or blue and green hair colors, as well as the magic animation wasn't overblown but executed nicely.


I did like the OP and ED it was nice and had no complaints.


Characters, well we have OP MC to infinity he can't die, he can kill easily and he doesn't care about anything except his sister or if people ask him to help. Miyuki was poorly done since they didn't really explain her near Yandere devotion to her brother. Then the rest were mildly done with little development but like I said they focused more on development of groups and relations like the 10 Familys, the Army, the country, and such. As for the supporting characters we have Tatsuya's group which consists of new students all trying to overcome their limitations as Weeds, each one has a unique skill which makes them useful but they never really take center stage, except in group fights or against other students, but they are never involved in the main story to a major role throughout.


Well that aside seeing a guy disintegrate other people is always fun and it was new, plus how they applied magic was unique as oppose to the annoying fire, water, wind, earth elements, it was more similar to Nanoha system of magic relying on tech assist. I enjoyed it because it moved the progression of perception of Tatsuya ,Weeds  & Blooms, and the role of magicians in society and how they are working to overturn the soldier mentality and stuff.


Well that aside the anime is one of the better ones out there and I would watch another season if possible, well that's all I got.

I still remember being told that this anime was going to be one of the greatest animes of the spring season. While I do have to say that it has a few strong points, it also has multiple flaws that prove that prediction wrong. (spoilers here)
Story-8/10
This anime is actually an anime that explains magic. Magic in this time period was engineered so that magicians could be created and used in war and such. It's 2095 and World War III ended years ago, but magicians are still being bred for the future. Tatsuya Shiba and Miyuki Shiba are extraordinary magicians who start off attending First HighSchool for magicians. Tatsuya is constantly looked down upon and underestimated for being a "Weed"--a 2nd course student who didn't place as a 1st course student like his slightly younger sister.


Art-6/10

I have to say that the art style is pretty original but average. The character designs aren't perfect and neither is the scenery, but it's consistent. And by consistent, I'm saying that it doesn't go from shitty to slaying from one scene to another.


Sound-8/10

The sound is a pretty strong point in this anime. Both of the OPs are fantastic and background music is nicely matched most of the time. The voice actors were alright, but my favorite was Tatsuya's because his voice was so dull sounding because he was a pretty dull character.


Character-5/10

This is where everything gets a bit messy for me. Tatsuya Shiba is your typical 'OP Male MC'. Emotionless but slays the game everytime somehow. Everytime someone underestimates him, Tatsuya shows them that doing that was the wrong thing to do by kicking their ass. Of course, there were times where I would scream,  "YAAAAS TATSUYA LEEGOOOO". But after awhile, that's all he ever did. He never failed or ever got emotional. It got boring. Of course, I know the reason why he's so emotionless, but they don't even explain that in the anime!! I found out by how? Spoilers. I think that they should've explained Tatsuya's dullness a bit more than they did. Anyways, I'm glad that a "Sword Art Online" wasn't pulled where the MC starts having trauma so "big" that they go into a mental breakdown for like 3 episodes.


And then there's Miyuki Shiba. I feel like they pulled an Asuna Yukki on her. (Sorry I just compare shitty things to Sword Art Online out of habit now) Miyuki is a total badass, but I hate to admit that they belittle her character to being a brocon. Miyuki is great; freezing things with magic is her specialty and she is super smart. But of course after a while, Miyuki only fights every now and then and then what's left is Tatsuya Shiba slaying the game once again and protecting Miyuki which makes her blush every five seconds. One of the things that irritated me the most was that it seemed as if Miyuki only lived for her brother. She always wanted to get permission  from him first about things and always listened to him and even if someone said his name in her presence, she'd turn to them and give them a hardcore death glare. You see, when I say that they pulled an Asuna Yukki, I mean that they made Miyuki seem like she was JUST an obsessive person. Obsessed with the person she loves. A Tatsuya Shiba fangirl. They write a character with great potential and just wreck it so that the male mc seems so cool. I've watched animes with brocons before, but this is one of the the only times that I feel that the character would be super irrelevant if the fanservice didn't rely on them. What's even grosser is that when you look up "tatsuya shiba mahouka koukou no rettousei" on google, you see a shitload of fan art and caps of Tatsuya + Miyuki, and it pretty much assured me 99.9% that a lot of the readers/viewers only mention Miyuki when Tatsuya's present. It's as if Miyuki's not even her own character.


Enjoyment-6

The first arc and Nine Schools Competition excited me the most, but they ended on one of the most confusing and boring arcs.


Overall-6

What do you get if you mix sibling love, magic and a protagonist who barely has any emotion? You get this anime. 
Story: 9/10
The story in this anime can make you sit for hours, just watching it, continuing without a care of what's happening in the outside world. It gave me goosebumps, watching through this anime. A story like this is very similar to other anime, also most of them being successful too. A protagonist who is a mere highschool student on the outside, but being one of the strongest characters in that anime in the inside. The only unique part here is of course,the sibling love, which can be very comedic most of the times. Each episode leaves you hanging, wanting to know what happens next.


Art: 9/10


The colors are very vibrant, not too dull. The animation is also smooth. Nothing much to say, this anime was released in 2014 so the art was to be expected.


Sound: 8/10


I find myself rocking to the music sometimes, recognizing that there is some type of electric music playing in the background. The OP matched the theme of this anime, being mostly action. The ED fitted too, fading in at the last minute of every episode. I'm not the type to really judge on OP/ED.


Characters: 8/10


I was looking for an anime that had a cool protagonist in an action anime, and I was impressed when I first saw this anime. Tatsuya is that type of guy who doesn't care about anyone else deeply except for one person. The way he handles things, how he talks, strategizing with his peers, he's basically the biggest badass in this anime. Miyuki, on the other hand, acts very elegantly. Of course, she has some weak spots like her brother, blushing whenever her brother compliments her dress, her looks or her actions towards people. Of course, if the relationship between the 2 siblings progress into incest, I would be fine with that mainly because their relationship was strong even at the beginning of the anime. But of course, laws in media in Japan bans incest.

(i'm not a siscon/brocon)


Enjoyment: 10/10 


This anime has very high re-watch value for me, not only because it has 24 episodes, every time you watch an episode, there will be surprises and maybe hair standing on your neck, if you're watching Tatsuya fight.


Overall: 9/10


What else can I say? It worked nicely as a school, sci-fi, romance, magic, supernatural, shounen anime. I'm surprised action isn't listed in the genre, but oh well.

It was nice art and a decent idea of placing magic in a school setting in the future. I won't give any spoilers, but overall this anime was pretty good. I liked the sound effects too. I don't know how they made them, but that was cool (actually though it's interesting to listen to the sound effects for each spell). I'm probably just a sucker for any anime nowadays that doesn't have a stupid useless main character, but this show comes off a bit too much on the high end of that. Our protagonist is exceptional in everything he does and this leaves essentially noroom for character development, and we don't see much in the way of development apart from secondary characters. I would rate this a 6.5 because of great art and sounds and story, but then I realized that the art is actually pretty decent so I decided to give it a 7. Worth a watch if you like magic anime with a strong male protagonist.

This show is extremely bland, nothing important happens at all throughout the entire series. I had to force myself to watch the entire show, and at times I couldn't have cared less for what was going on. Along with a boring show, the characters were stale, hiding any type of human emotion and making the characters unbelievable.  First off, the magic in the show isn't even magic, it is all future technology, secondly, they hardly spend any time in school, they actually divided the show into three parts that have nothing to do with each other. Further more, the sound track was terrible, andat times a little cringe worthy. All and all, the show was tasteless and boring, I would have had a better time eating bread, at least it has more flavor.

Mahouka Koukou no Rettousei was quite an enjoyable watch! 
Right off the bat, though, it must be mentioned that this anime is not for everyone! I say this for a couple of reasons. 
1. The main character (protagonist) is extremely talented, borderline perfect. He is a very talented magician and engineer with only a minor flaw. 
2. There is a lot of dialogue explaining the theories behind the magic used. 
3. There is a hint of incest between the main character and his younger sister. 
In any case, some of the same points mentioned above can be reasons one would like the anime. 
As forone, I enjoyed watching the main character. Although he is very talented and intellectually gifted, he lacks a fundamental skill: the physical manipulation of magic. Throughout the anime, it can be observed that the main character works around his limitations by using his other skills to the max. It is his thinking process and the way he works through a predicament that makes the story and conflicts interesting, despite his character being near-perfect. It is also interesting to see how the plot slowly reveals how much power this character possesses. (It's almost as if the main character is a little mysterious, and you slowly uncover the mystery as you watch the anime.)\n\n
As for another, I feel that the theories and explanations regarding the magic used in a fight, or a newest invention, really makes the anime more realistic. It shows that magic is really contingent on science. It shows that magic is not only an innate ability, but also a system that involves science and technology. Hearing the hypothetical theories and analysis of magic used in fights is quite interesting and makes it seem more logical and practical.\n\n
As for incest... well, I can't say I approve of it, but their interaction, if you overlook that they are siblings, was quite sweet, even if it is a bit edgy, in a romantic sense. \n\n
Overall, this anime is not only technical from a logical perspective, but also includes the fantasy aspects, such as a lot of magic. \n\n
So, if you enjoy slowing finding out about a character as the anime progresses, this anime is for you. If you enjoy watching characters plan and problem solve, this anime is for you. If you enjoy reasoning, and you just like to hear what some would consider to be "textbook boring" dialogue, then this anime is for you! If you enjoy sweet sibling interactions, this anime is also for you! \n\n
I hope you enjoyed this review, and hopefully it was helpful. Thanks for reading!

In all honesty, this anime does not have a crazy good story. However, the premise of the story, along with the badass exploits of our MC, kept me watching. A future civilization imbued with magic is like Academy City and the Anglican Church had a baby.
But enough of that. In all honesty, there were lots of cute girls. Forget a passable story, forget the somewhat forgettable but simultaneously likable characters. There were lots of cute girls. Kiss X Sis has twisted me into a state where incest in anime is all good if the sister is cute. And yep, the MC's sister is part ofa large group of cute girls.


Nothing else besides the girls matters. Nothing.


Also, my review is pretty much useless.


I like cute girls.

After watching this anime, I consider this one of the best fighting anime, comes with magic and combat.
I was actually hoping for a bit more romance in this anime, I let's hope there is a Part 2, can't wait to watch it.
The Storyline story of interesting, as there's never ending fighting and different kinds of magic and combat style by each character in the anime, so far one of my favourite anime among those that I watch.
The plot is basically a main character and his sister and a group of interesting friends fighting evil. At the start might be boring but don't stop watching untilthe end.\n\n
Hope you enjoy it.\n\n
PS: I was hoping Shiba, Tatsuya & Saegusa, Mayumi get together.\n\n
Can't wait for the next Part 2! :)

Seems like people either love or loathe this anime. Honestly, I think the former are uninformed/younger watchers who are just along for the ride without looking at the technical aspects of a good anime, while the latter are the pompous otakus who overanalyze the hell out of everything they watch. This anime is a solid average. Will you remember it for years to come? Probably not. But it is enjoyable to watch. Here's a quick and dirty list of some pros and cons:
Pros:
- Fantastic art
- Good soundtrack, if a little repetitive
- Badass fight scenes
- A few likeable characters (Erika and Leo for me)
- Take onmagic is unique and interesting\n\n
Cons:\n
- Bad story. Plot essentially felt nonexistent at times\n
- MC is boring and extremely overpowered (it is fun to watch him wreck people though)\n
- A bit harem-ish for my liking\n
- Sister-brother love. That's just wrong\n\n
In the end, this kinda seems like it was designed to be a wish-fulfillment anime for fat, lonely otakus with little attention paid to the story. The MC is ridiculously strong and constantly has women throwing themselves at him, even his sister. There were so many scenes that I felt were designed expressly to make Tatsuya look cool in front of his friends (hey soldier, we're gonna discuss your top secret mission in front of everyone so they can all see how badass you are). The villains are forgettable, mainly just there so Tatsuya has someone to destroy. They kept dropping hints about the MCs backstory but I guess decided to never explain it (What happened to Tatsuya  when he was young? Why are they no longer Yotsubas?).\n\n
But aside from all that nonsense, I still enjoyed the anime. The fight scenes were awesome, and the science/magic hybrid concept is pretty unique and cool. I actually enjoyed the exposition that everyone seems to hate. It's not as bad as these snobs would have you believe.

"This anime in two words- Onii-Sama"
When I first started watching this anime, I expected another plotless magic anime with a weak MC.
I was completely wrong.
This anime showed the school life of Tatsuya and Miyuki Shiba, a brother and sister, attending a magical high school.
Seemingly, in that school, there are "course 1" and "course 2" students, and course 1 gives the students magical training while "course 2" don't.
In here, the difference is showed perfectly, and showing that even Tatsuya , who is a Course 2 student, is strong in its own way.
As the anime progresses, enemies attack, fights erupt, and Tatsuya and his friends fight.
The fightswere exciting.\n\n
This anime also has a concept of romance, it has many potential ships.\n
A problem with this anime was that when you start watching it, many terms are thrown at you, and most of them aren't explained, and you just forget about some of them, and can't  understand the others.\n\n
The story was nice, It was set mostly in the high school and the city, and the fights that happened around those places, the story involved school competitions and projects.\n
Story 8/10.\n\n
The art wasn't too colorful, it seemed like if "favored" green and white, mostly because of their school uniforms.\n
Art 6/10.\n\n
OP 1+2 Were great\n
ED 1 was meh, ED 2 was nice.\n
Also, nice fighting music track\n
Sound given 8/10.\n\n
Characters\n
The characters relationships, and development felt a bit off, and rushed.\n
We don't know much about the pasts of the important people, or their characteristics.\n
Characters given 7/10.\n\n
Overall enjoyment 8/10.\n
I liked this anime, it went smoothly and involved great fighting scenes and you're always tensed about the MC- Tatsuya, what is he gonna do next?\n

When I first saw the show, there was something about it that made me want to watch it. I wasn't sure what it was at first, but as soon as the plot started to move along I really started to like it. The show is fast paced with great characters who really allow the show to set itself apart from others. The introduction of magic, slowly shows the rift between those who can use magic and those who can't. The show never has a dull moment. Whether it is the Nine Schools Competition Arc or the Yokohama Disturbance Arc, the show just keeps building onitself. The main character Tatsuya and his sister Miyuki have an interesting relationship between one another to say the least. This was my one gripe with this otherwise incredible show because I felt very awkward whenever Miyuki tried to make a move with her brother. However being able to look past these moments, always proved to be the best thing because the show always followed it up with a very well done action sequence. The art for this show is done very well. It is both bright and vibrant, which really make the show stand out in an action genre. The way this anime integrated CGI into the 2-D world make it look really well. I would compare it's flawless integration to that of the CGI in the Neon Genesis Evangelion rebuild films. Overall, I highly recommend this show to anyone who wants an all around great show.

Here's a video review of it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kQ9NlSmJZ8
First off wow.... Just wow.
At the start of this anime I expected nothing but generic and to be honest this anime doesn't start off the best way. 
It doesn't really do much to explain what is going, why can't he use magic, why is he at a lower level, and the uniform colors felt so plain.
But if you like anime shows with action and a decent story line similar to anime series like Guilty Crown and Tokyo Ravens then this is right up your alley. At the start this anime starts off with two main characters who are brother andsister, while the relationship between them feels off you can tell its mostly on the sisters side. 

This anime series is based off a world where magic exists and has been utilized as a technology for nearly a century and while explaining it would be rather confusing without watching the anime… I'll try my best to break it down in simpler terms. In the anime Mages use something called a Casting Assistant Device or CAD… at least that’s how I pronounce it. Mages use thought particles or psions to activate sequences which invoke magic spells basically. A good way to sum up this concept is imagine if you wanted to do a spell, rather than memorize each spell mentally you could save it in CAD and simply activate it with the thought of wanting to use that spell.

The plot in the anime is basically about Tatsuya and Miyuki who are both brother and sister. They are new students who enrolled at a Private Magic University Affiliated High School. In this school the students are ranked based on their test scores reflecting on mainly their practical magic ability skills. Students who score higher are put into a Course 1 curriculum and those who score lower are enrolled in Course 2.

Unfortunately, when you separate students based on a certain attribute you eventually end up with issues mainly things like bullying which this school has. The two separate courses are known as Bloom and Weed although the term is against the school policy and it's quite disrespectful.

Tatsuya unfortunately was put in Course 2 while his sister was put in Course 1. As the story progresses you immediately see the mistreatment of Course 2 students. Tatsuya however isn't on the same level as the rest of the students. He may lack skills in magic, but his stamina for what he has allows him to learn some high level Magic Spells that don't require a high amount of magic to be used. Also while he isn't good at magic all that well, he is incredibly smart and extremely good at physical combat, combined with his magic, he makes simple basic magic spells become amplified and much stronger than they were initially.

While Tatsuya is the main character of the story for the most part, his sister plays a role in sort of guiding Tatsuya and pushing him to try to push himself to prove that magic isn't the only important skill. Throughout the anime you see that to be true.

The Story itself is pretty damn good, as generic as the anime may sound it does have its own way of telling its story. At the start is does a very good job explaining a lot of the spells so that you understand how this world works, the plot for the main half of the story is probably the most exciting part in my opinion. While I left out some stuff, a lot of the good stuff I'd love to talk about contains spoilers to the anime that could down play some of the plots, but there is more to Tatsuya that really builds up his character that I didn't mention.On that note I'd love to say that the cast of characters was pretty good, while they never went too deep with those characters and their backgrounds, they never felt bland or boring at all.


Let's get to the review.


Story - 8 | Amazing!

Before I get bashed on this, the story itself if beyond amazing…. But for the first half, everything is paced out a bit too slow but at least they take time to explain a lot of the magic and go into detail about the main characters, mainly towards the lives they live and what else they work on aside from the school itself. But the second half is what hurts the anime, it sort of becomes a war without meaning, at least not well explained. I don't want to spoil what goes on during the second half, but it sort of rushes you through everything, and kind of destroys a lot of the mystery behind Tatsuya who the whole anime was based on. In a way I can say that if there is a second season the school portion part will either be a hit or miss, it can be worked into something real good or can completely be a disaster.


Characters - 7 | Quite Good

The characters in the anime are extremely good when it comes to support, they actually feel like they are part of the story and not just there to fill the gap of other students the school. The majority of the cast gets very little back story if any at all aside from one or two characters. However for this particular case I didn't mind all that much, for what we learned about the characters throughout the anime was good enough and the support towards the Main Characters Tatsuya and his sister was enough to keep the anime going strong. But while I enjoyed the characters, I did wish the relationship between the characters could've grown more, each character had some character development but it always had to be when Tatsuya was there, never anything aside from that. If Tatsuya wasn't there then there would be no character development, just a minor gripe against it.


Art/Animation - 6 | It's Okay

For 2014 the anime feels kinda dated, it not that the visuals are bad but so many anime series are pushing on towards looking so colorful and smooth, while this anime had extremely dull color pallet overall. Nothing really popped, and while sometimes it didn't matter, other times it just made some of the characters sink in with the background, if it was not for the story this anime could have fallen part cause of this. Luckily the fight scenes are pretty damn amazing, and while the colors feel dull, the animation for the fights and suspense of the story keep you sucked in enough to not care. Which proves art isn't everything.


Music/Sound - 6 | It's Okay

The OST itself was okay, mainly the one issue I had was that there was one song that always played when there was a fight scene but at least it was a good song. The sound and voice acting were good… not amazing but not terrible though it was better than acceptable. The Opening and Ending Tracks I actually liked a lot.


Enjoyment - 9 | Astonishing!

You may be wondering why everything else seemed so low and this score is much higher.. Well the best way I can put it is that this anime may not have the best visuals or even the best characters but the story and world is so good. Sure it's not amazing, but it's different from most anime shows that use magic with science. Tatsuya grows and proves that Magic really isn't everything despite him not being the best Mage there. He knows when he can win a match versus when he needs help. To be honest if it wasn't because they explained how the magic worked I would've turned away but because they explained it enough to the point where I can understand I wanted to learn more about enemies in the anime and how Tatsuya could overcome things that were out of his level in some way. This anime is likely a guilty pleasure of mine.


Final Rating: 7 |  Quite Good [Exact Rating - 7.2]

Let's be clear the anime isn't the best anime to ever come to existence, it has some faults which are pretty big and my make some people not want to watch the anime like the pacing at the start, not much story for a lot of the characters, and the art being just overall okay. But the Story in the anime really holds it, the way everything is explained in the first couple of episodes and how Tatsuya proves himself out throughout the anime. Where the plot gets dull is around the end but it kind of left me wanting more and wondering what would turn out after what happens. What also kind of sucked is we didn't really  learn much about the organization or gang thing that they were sort of associated with which I was left like uhhhh okay???? The characters were basically there for just support, and while that's okay maybe some story about the ones who were seen the most would have been nice, but there was some character development going on but not much since the anime was centered around Tatsuya. The OST could be rather forgettable aside from the Opening and Ending songs which I liked, but it could be cause it had LiSA's song "Rising Hope", and LiSA has had other songs I really enjoyed. Probably my main issue was the uniform colors, it just felt so boring and dull, but you get over it eventually. I will end with saying that the first 1-3 or 1-4 episodes were pretty boring because it has a lot to do with explaining a crud load of stuff and for an "action" anime there isn't much action until a few more episodes down. Around Episode 5 the anime begins to stir some interesting plots and the action begins soon after, I recommend most stick with it if you liked Anime Shows like Guilty Crown and Tokyo Ravens, but if you didn't like those anime then this won't be your cup of tea. As for me I loved both Guilty Crown and Tokyo Ravens and while it wasn't as amazing as those two, it was anime worth watching.

I will not write a large review because all the other reviews cover almost all the good/bad aspects of this show. I will mention some bad points I found:
 -First of all, despite all what fans say about novels, what you get on screen is what is important for an anime; and what you get on screen is what you would get if you put Hadji from Blood+ in a high school & magic series. The MC is an emotionless guardian of a High School girl, but what you see in the series is that he is more focused in helping in club activitiesthan guarding this girl. This overpowered emotionless sis-con main character ends up involved in some "High-school police club" and in a "science project" in the last arc, only to show he is super cool minded and intelligent and strong. But if he has no feelings why he participates in activities that feed ego, and if he is so intelligent how the convince him??

The only girl that doesn't fall for him, is just used for a scene where they say something like this : "You like Tatsuya but as he is super power full and cool and you are just mediocre you choose a mediocre boy, because you will never be as godlike like him"

 -Second, they over explain everything. When they cast a spell they explain all the steps and the names and the calculations,etc. It is not intelligent, it fills empty spaces with senseless blah blah blah...


 Conclusion: As the anime is 100% the main character and the main character is inconsistent and empty (ON SCREEN) and isn't enough interesting (At least without the novels information) , the show is quite monotone and repetitive. 


(Story 2 + Art 6 + Sound 5 + Character 1 + Enjoyment 1)/5 = 3

Another long english title. Here we have a show that seems to have a ton of production value go into it, and what came out of it was an uneven balance scale. On one hand, you got amazing action scenes with a hit or miss soundtrack for viewers, on the other you got a very underdevloped world with under developed characters. What happens when you combine these two? The irregular at magic high school.
I'll start with the story which seems to be really unfocused and seems to be an ass pull as means to develop the world we experience in the show. Well it sureas hell did not do that. The show starts with our prodigy main protagonist Tatsuya go to school. I wonder who the title can be referring to. The story is pretty vague until the end, this prodigy protagonist has a sister he very much adores and the feeling is mutual. Tatsuya is amazing but is ranked as low as a noob; so the story starts out with all the characters finding out just how amazing he is and the potential he holds. Then we get to see him pull shit out of his ass and everything just happens to be better/resolved whenever he does it. 


Now the beef that I have with this story is that we get an understanding of how magic became part of the world, but the story does not dive deeper into what it could be. Things like discrimination are briefly mentioned, but that is just within the school. What about the rest of world? Is there a reason some people can't use magic and what are the terrorist groups true motives? Unfortunately these realistic themes were not tackled; I believe part of this was due to this show being a high school setting. Overall, story is wasted potential and is very predictable with a bunch of asspulls and plot conveniences.


Okay so the characters can be summed up with 2 words, one dimensional. It's not a big deal for me if the main protagonist was a genius and that their overpowered abilities were justified, but having a bunch of characters being on the same boat? It just makes every action scene feel underwhelming, predictable, pretentious, tedious, etc. There is really nothing much to say about the characters because they were so underdeveloped and there was a boatload of characters introduced to us. The show is set up where viewers just need to watch the eye candied action scenes. As for other aspects of the characters, you know the show's romance is bad when the side characters have a more genuine romantic relationship compared to the main protagonist and heroine. 

side note: it got pretty annoying when the plot influenced Tatsuya's actions and the characters were on his d!ck the whole time, especially Miyuki (onee sama)


Sound is hit or miss for viewers i think. There is a mix of dubstep, EDM and soft medleys through the OST. I found it to be pretty average, no standouts. I liked the first opening and both endings. Disliked the 2nd opening. Voice actors are a little bland but its deserved since bland characters and bland story.


Animation is pretty sick. Leave it to Madhouse to make some sick action scenes involving magic and matrix like movements. Character designs were standard, but the gore and spells were on point. 


I came into this show knowing that Tatsuya was a very very strong protagonist and its not like that bugged me, but the lack of development for everything put me off. There were just too many plot conveniences that made him stand out and it was like a broken record by the end of the show. I felt like I've been left in the desert to dry up while Tatsuya goes does whatever and makes it better. The potential of the story is astounding, but it is limited to this high school setting. I mean it's just so convenient to have a high school freshman be so capable right? Assuming the intended audience is for teens, then this show certainly fulfills that gap. 

Well for what we got, its pretty decent to watch for the animation. I can't recommend this though since it feels repetitive and gets boring quickly. It amazes me that top tier class production studios and voice actors were used for this. 


i never want to hear the words "onee sama" ever again

This was by far one of the best animes I've watched but it is not everyone's cup of tea. If you are not bothered by a protagonist who never loses and don't consider an incestuous relationship as a taboo then I would definitely recommend you watch this.
Though it is set in the future the conditions are well thought of and the scenario is quite practical if you give it a thought 
This anime tends to be descriptive way often then not but if you are a fan of the sci-fi genre this will surely not disappoint you because the explanations are well thought off. Havingread 16 light novels till now I haven't found anything that disobeys the laws of physics based on the explanations given.\n\n
Overall I will rate this anime 10 mainly because there is a lot of homework done on the setting and the protagonist though seriously overpowered doesn't come of as an arrogant and bad persoon

To start off, I went ahead and read what people summarized about the Light Novels and their individual chapters after watching the anime just because I was curious to find out what happened next, but didn't feel like trying to find translations to spend countless hours reading.
May also contain spoilers for the anime as reference to ratings, so I will try to keep them minimum at best or at least try to censor them.
Story 5/10: The story is workable to an extent, but it goes virtually nowhere to explain the main characters, Tatsuya Shiba and Miyuki Shiba, or their other worldly strong abilities compared toliterally anyone else. It touches the subject of Tatsuya near the end of the anime, in roughly the last 2 or 3 episodes, but by then they forced it into an unreasonable "Prophetic Doomsday" scenario. They also spiral out of control and describe, in excessive detail, the overly specific nature of some of the things happening in the show.


Art 7/10: Animated by the famous Madhouse, which means it is excellently fluid and well animated, especially during high-action moments. But this also means the chances for a second season is virtually none. Not that it is a bad thing, considering where the Light Novel is currently treading as of Volume 16 onwards. It would likely be torn apart and cop-out filled nonsense, so that is a plus.


Sound 8/10: Perfectly fine sound and voice acting. Ironically stars a few voice actors from "OreImo" as the main characters with incest subtext surrounding them. Action sequence sound and "Magic" casting are all well done and didn't seem out of place either, moreover they fit in well.


Character 7/10: Character development was moreover sketchy in this. In reality there was very little character development outside of select moments which then escalated to dramatically.


- Tatsuya Shiba - Incapable of feeling any emotion towards anyone but his sister. Sees women flirting with him as general annoyances and cannot comprehend their feelings whatsoever. He frequently turns a blind eye to any flirty behavior towards him and even mocks them in some cases while confirming to his sister that he is thoroughly not interested. He even brushes off a love confession in the Light Novels with a completely emotionless face.


- Miyuki Shiba - Tatsuya's younger sister by a poultry 11 months, meaning they are virtually the same age and even misinterpreted as twins early on in the first episode. She is disgusted by the mere notion of spending her life with anyone but her brother, and is incredibly obvious about her Incestuous love for him. Of which is convenient since he is effectively lobotomized and can only feel any emotion towards her specifically. She is also portrayed as "the perfect women", flawless looks, polite, ladylike, graceful, etc. So much so that even her brother is frequently mesmerized by her beauty and has to regain his composure. He also comments on her, which makes her extremely happy, considering her Incestuous thoughts.


- Saegusa Mayumi - The student council president, and also an airhead with, as Tatsuya quotes, unrealistic and unreachable ideals that would destroy the foundation of society. She apparently has feelings for Tatsuya, of which he is thoroughly annoyed by and ignores.


- Masaki Ichijou - Some bloke introduced halfway through the anime series. So egotistical that he ignores any and all women that try to get his attention, and only sees Miyuki as a love interest because she is powerful and perfect. This crush is incredibly one-sided though as Miyuki is especially repulsed by him. This is very evident in the novels, as the anime instead opts to have her reluctantly ignore his very presence without further explanation.


Nobody else specifically matters, and is only there to push the plot forward at times.


- SPOILER - After a marriage is *gleefully* arranged between 2 other characters in Volume 16 of the light novel, the fathers of Mayumi and Masaki try to force the marriage apart for their own personal gains. What is even more insulting about this is that the Mayumi and Masaki have little to no intentions themselves to break up the marriage. It's just that their fathers forced them to confess their undeveloped feelings for the soon-to-be-wed couple and are trying to use these undeveloped feelings as leverage. It doesn't work at all, and to the contrary it is reinforced by saying that they were quite literally made for and are destined to be with one-another. Reinforced further by quoting that "Separating them is quite literally causing the end of the world".



Enjoyment 7/10: The plot wasn't actually very predictable in each story arc, which is a plus. Loads of anime you can guess exactly how a story arc is going to end as soon as it starts. In this case yes, you know the overpowered Main Characters Tatsuya and Miyuki will probably win. But it is never really obvious that they will, nor does it follow an overly linear path. The smaller arcs within the main arcs are frequently explored and solved in interesting ways.


Overall 7/10: A reasonable introduction to the series, as most of Madhouse' productions are seeing as they generally refuse to do sequels or second seasons of any kind. It explores the original content well and doesn't exclude too much detail to the point that continuing with the source material doesn't make sense. For those who hate overpowered Main Characters, probably don't watch it. For others, it serves as an intro and nothing more to the series, as it doesn't go too far into detail, but doesn't quite go far enough if you think about it too hard.

I hate to say this but Mahouka Koukou no Rettousei is actually pretty good.
I know many people dislike the anime, calling it a lousy rip-off of SAO and many other animes but the thing is, I personally feel it’s not.
Sure, Mahouka is pretty mainstream in a sense since it has a similar concept of ‘weak’ MC is actually ‘Overpowered 1-hit KO GOD’
However, the development of Mahouka is actually very impressive.
We start off with Tatsuya and his Sister, Miyuki getting enfolded into a top magic high school where Tatsuya due to his poor magic skills got enlisted into the lousy class where the other good classesdespise him as well as his classmates.


The story goes on as many more characters get introduced into the anime.


Eventually, Tatsuya gets closer to those characters slowly and steadily revealing glimpses of his power to others.


Tatsuya also has a mountain of secrets that are highly confidential and almost untraceable. Secrets that reveal how powerful he actually is.


-Spoilers Below-


Tatsuya actually wields a unique type of magic (counter-magic), being the potential heir to the Yotsuba clan, his family’s clan and also one of the strongest clans amongst the Ten Master Clans, he got rejected as a member when his Sister was born due to his inability to wield ‘proper magic’ (destruction magic) the thing is, Tatsuya’s magic is extremely powerful, much stronger than his Sister whom is also Overpowered as hell.


Tatsuya got subjected to experiments to enhance his magic powers in hopes of allowing him to use other magic making him even more powerful. He is basically a weapon and because he would not be the heir, the heir was passed on to his sister whom he got reduced to be the guardian of. Not to say he doesn’t love his Sister, he loves her very much and holds no grudges against her.


He has sworn to protect his Sister and also, since he was a genius he devised and manufactured weapons and magic spells/techniques for the military and personal use enhancing his weak magic prowess making him an even larger force to be reckoned with. Now we begin to ponder why he doesn’t just take back the heir by battling his aunt, the master of the clan.


Along the anime, the people he meet are weaker than he  however are also extremely strong because Tatsuya is in a world of his own, unrivalled.


These strong people command much power and begin to acknowledge Tatsuya after catching glimpses of his prowess.


-Spoiler End-


The anime is filled with intense fight scenes with a very good development of characters, not the best but there is a sequel movie I hope they will provide the other details in. 


The sound effects are also very good and OP is of SAIKO as LiSA is in it.


The character designs are also pretty decent except some like Fujibayashi and Mibu, aren’t they just rip-off designs of Rin Tohsaka???


TL;DR


Great anime

LiSA sang the OP

Overpowered MC with a mountain of secrets

OVERPOWERED MC from an OVERPOWERED FAMILY

MC has a hell lot of family problems and is a big mystery


MC has a harem

Cute girls and beautiful slice of life scenes, even a ‘accidentally walked in on a pretty girl bathing scene’


Cool graphics and sound effects


Dope ass visuals


Bro sis romance


Sister Complex

Bro complex


Hentai <<Jk if there is, the reruns on this show will be uncountable

So this Anime has quite the variation of reviews on it, so heres my take on it. 
I stumbled onto this anime after watching Hagure Yuusha no Esthetica, and it was in my PTW for a while.  Apparently when it came out it was a "hot" anime at the time, one of those highly anticipated ones. 
Story
Its good but not great. Honestly its largely a rerun on the magic school genre with an overpowered MC in the mix. Its a good formula, but not an original one. This anime also uses the "three-arc" storyline for the anime, but this time around it felt muchmore in place, and connected with each other. For the most part, the arcs connected together, most likely due to it's 26-episode length. Story was engaging, but the OP MC never loses, so you already know vaguely whats going to happen. The Romance aspect is there and its a great counterpoint to the fighting/competition. However, this anime does have A LOT of moving parts that don't get explained even with it's dialogue heavy beginning. I liked the premise of how magic became accepted and the world alliances were a nice dystopian touch. overall an 8 out of 10. 


Art: 

Art and animation was fluid, dynamic, and it was visually appealing. Basically the girls were cute and the guys were cool looking. Gears, weapons, unifroms were appealing, and modern. building architecture was futuristic. none of the colors were too bright or sharp, although they were more pastel-y than I would have liked. This is one of the few anime that doesn't suffer from the colorful hair syndrome, where all the MCs have colorful hair and everyone else doesn't. However, I did notice that for some reason there seemed to be a huge amount of guys in relation to the girls. that is at other schools. anytime there were a crap-ton of students gathered, most were guys, even though there must have been girls too. Either way, a solid 10/10 for art.


Sound:

HOLY. CRAP. IT. IS. GOOD. Not only were the opening and ending songs great pieces of music, it was the quality of music WITHIN the anime that really got me. the combination of subtle techno/electric music with the futuristic setting and the cool-animated magic was a master move by the director. And im not one to exaggerate. I rarely ever hear the sound in an anime, and I rarely listen to opening/closing songs, but man these were great. Voice actors fit the characters well, there werent any curveballs or misfits. The sound of weaponry, magic, and fighting was more or less realistic. 10/10 cus I actually noticed the music for once, and it just fit so well with the anime. 


Characters:

Theyre all pretty damn good. like i said before, visually appealing. Most of them do not undergo any sort of character change though. However, they all do serve some purpose, and all exemplify a certain strength that makes them work well as a team. And thats were the bulk of the points for the characters come in. Even though there is alot, and even though I cant remember the names of them all, all of them had a purpose, they weren't placed there just as placeholders or people for the MC to exploit. All of the characters had genuine personality, struggles, and purpose. These come together beautifully, and the synergy between them is amazingly done. however...

Note:OP MC

Ok so spoilers maybe. THIS MC IS SUPER OVERPOWERED. he is basically a military genius who enrolls in a high school for magic. But, because he can't move a block on the floor with ease, he sucks by academy standards. He is literally on the cutting edge of magic in his world and is coming up with analytical solutions to age-old magic conundrums. He goes around one-shotting anything that can move (living or mechanical), and also can obliterate a platoon of 20-30 warships with one shot. He has the ability to do a complete and instantaneous regen on himself or his allies. . He has extremely high pain tolerance levels, but not that he ever needs it for himself cus he almost never gets hurt. He's holding back on his power for like 90% of the series. With that said, I personally actually loved that. his power is awesome. the best i can describe it is he has the ability to take apart/ put things back together at the atomic level. with one shot of course. But I also understand that OP MCs, or MCs that never lose aren't for everyone so be forewarned if you dislike this. 


Enjoyment

Obviously this is a subjective category but for me I was highly influenced by my own "chuunibyou" fantasies. I have always dreamed up of a setting where I had an Overpowered ablilty like Tatsuya's and the support of a diverse team behind me. To see it now 10 years later in an anime, and such a well done one at that was a trip down nostalgia lane. However, that was not the only reason I enjoyed it. It has all the elements that I like such as fantasy, romance, school setting, and of course the OP MC. On top of that this was the first 26-episode series that I watched, and I have to say the length was actually enjoyable. 


Overall

a weak 10/10. I would give it a 9.5 or 9.7  if I could. I liked everything about it except the story. It had great premises, setting, and meshing but it was just a bit too unexplained, and a bit too trite for me to absolutely enjoy. The OP MC was also predictable with outcomes, but I can't bring myself to dock a full point for just those things. so Id say overall, 2 for story + 2 for characters + 2.5 for art +2.5 for music + 1 for nostalgia - 0.2 for unexplained story and -0.1 for predictability = 9.7/10. 


Peace.

I personally haven't read the manga, so my review is solely based on my experience in watching the anime.  I wouldn't say there was anything special about the character designs; let's just say they're aesthetically pleasing to the eyes. There's this one character (Miyuki) whose character design is quite generic, yet she constantly receives praise for her beauty (I still don't get that). Then we have Tatsuya, Mr. OP (he's seriously one of the most OP anime characters I've ever come across). He's such a badass though. Anyway, throughout the story you will meet interesting characters, each with their own specialty and powers. Theplot is quite interesting: it's set in an alternate universe in our world (alternate timeline), where magic is harnessed with the help of technology. The story focuses on a pair of siblings: Miyuki and Mr. OP, but other than that, the story isn't anything special (I would say one of the anime's weak points is how it handles the plot). There are a bunch of badass action scenes covered by Mr. OP in this anime, and there really needs to be a season 2 for this anime because there were quite a few plot holes. The soundtrack for this anime however is probably one of the most exhilarating and liveliest ones I've heard; a mix of electro beats, rap, and classical instrumentals that'll sure tickle your ears. This anime features quite an exciting world with an OP character, so if you're into OP characters, flawless fight scenes, and badass battle music, watch this anime. -flamingshitbag

I'm going to be honest here. I have no idea why this anime gets as many gripes as it does. I get that it excludes a lot from the light novel. I get that because of this the pacing is too slow and sporadic for the average shounen viewer. But some of the complaints I've seen just make me shake my head. I personally genuinely enjoyed this anime, and I will explain why.
Story - 7
While it has plenty of potential, I have no issues saying for those that read the light novel there are plenty of parts omitted to make way for the excellent lastarc in the anime. This can leave the viewer occasionally questioning various aspects of the show, I personally was able to grasp or understand well enough what happened, but I don't expect everyone to. In fact, I didn't even know that much had been removed from the show until I looked up the reviews for it. I checked what arcs were removed and read the summaries, and I really couldn't care less that they were removed. God forbid they don't insert the beach episode. 


Furthermore, I was kept interested nearly every episode. Even though the first arc is slow and contains lots of talking, I wanted to know more. More about the characters, more about our lord and savior Tatsuya Shiba (We'll get into that later) , more about magic, more about the world itself, more about the societal struggles faced in the show, more about everything.


Simply put, for those that cannot stand sitting still and having to learn more about the world of the show, you just have to watch more explosions and action, and the protagonist getting up wiping blood from his mouth, spouting some line repeated over and over in the show related to friendship then barely beating his smug enemy with a massive OP move out of nowhere, this anime isn't for you.


Also, there are no filler episodes where the plot frustratingly just stops, the plot is always advancing, regardless of pace. Which I find fantastic.


Art - 8


The art isn't extremely stand out in the field of anime, however it is done fairly well, and I like the character designs well enough. Certainly, the art quality far exceeds shows like Naruto, where when I quit watching the characters seem to be made of play doh wearing clothes, vaguely resembling people.


Sound - 9


My man, Iwasaki Taku. I love his work. The composer for this soundtrack was also behind other anime soundtracks such as Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: Battle Tendency, Soul Eater, and Gurren Lagann. 


The soundtrack is extremely unique, containing Indian music, electro, jazz, funk, songs in French, and a ballroom dance song that contains some of the best English I have ever heard sung by a Japanese person in Vespertine Bloom.


Characters - 8


This is where most of the controversy happens. A lot of people accustomed to specific plot types and character arcs find the different directions the story takes unlikable. We'll start with the biggest topic.


God- er, I mean, Tastuya Shiba, is possibly one of the most badass characters in anime as of late, yet seems to get a lot of hate. This completely baffles me. He is not at all the typical anime protagonist, nor is he a "Gary Stu". The anime doesn't try to make him some relatable everyman learning about how the world works and being dragged blindly through the story along with the viewer, nor does he showcase any other tired and worn out protagonist cliches. He is, refreshingly, a totally competent, logical, dignified, polite, socially adept, and obviously a hilariously broken individual the anime doesn't really try to downplay or hide.


It seems a lot of people just wanted another anime where the same boring cycle of "most powerful bad guy yet shows up, wins for 95% of the arc, but then through BS gets defeated by the protagonist just barely." Rinse and repeat. No, Tatsuya ignores that by just being awesome. And his OPness isn't from the writers just being lazy, there are very obvious plot reasons that will likely get thoroughly expanded upon if a season 2 comes out. 


One thing some viewers didn't seem to wrap their minds around was the results Tatsuya had in his practical skills test at the very beginning of the anime. "Why are they so low, this is just some lazy way to pretend that the main character is flawed." I respond by saying not at all. It has nothing to do with making Tatsuya seem flawed. Instead, it is to further establish on the idea that the society they live in is flawed and uses narrow-minded tests to measure ability and competency, resulting in genuinely talented people being regarded as average or less. Sound familiar? Tatsuya, due to plot reasons, is extremely unbalanced when it comes to his abilities with magic. He is completely unable to use some forms of magic, and is extremely proficient in his own unique abilities. So it is completely believable that he couldn't perform well in a test such as that.


Finally, moving onto another character, Tatsuya's younger sister Miyuki is probably one of my bigger issues with the show. She is completely infatuated with her "Onii-sama", to where it seems to dominate her character. There are implied reasons for this, and we will get an explanation for it in season 2 of the show. Aside from that, she just seems polite and mild-mannered despite her absurd amount of magical power.


The rest of the cast is decent and has some interesting foundations for development in the next season , aside from maybe Mizuki at the moment, the shy glasses character, but that is more likely just because I am worn out on that character stereotype. Some mentionable side characters for me are Erika, Mikhiko, and of course, Mayumi. Mayumi, in particular, is a character I like. She is logical, intelligent, and an excellent leader. It is nice to see an intelligent female anime character that isn't also just monotone and matter of fact to communicate how smart her character is.


Enjoyment - 9


I feel I have spoken enough on most aspects of the show, and it is clear I enjoyed the experience greatly. If one isn't wanting cookie cutter stories and characters (once again, aside from Mizuki), then I think enjoyment can be had a plenty watching this show.


Overall- 8


I encourage those that watched it and disliked the OPness of the main character to re-evaluate the plot elements in the show and try to deviate their mindset from typical shounen archetypal stories and characters. I legitimately like this show, and think it is worth watching for those not wanting just explosions, maybe some story as well.

Spoiler Free
This anime appeals to young adults age 15-24 (my personal view ) . My guess is the people who give harsh reviews have too high standards. Yes, there are other masterpieces out there but don't criticize this series. Listen to the story carefully and do your best to understand!

If you are eager to watch this just go for it and if you don't like my words here just watch it . Maybe you will give a rating like a 3,4,5,6,7-10 but regardless you won't easily find an anime with this kind of plot. An anime is made to be watched and to be enjoyed or disappointed. This is my first review, I had to do something toward some opinions some opinions that give bad impression for the show.
If you read the synopsis, you know that the story is about a brother (Tatsuya) and his sister (Miyuki) ,she's talented unlike him but if I had to say something about him I would say that he’s the main reason why the show is awesome .he's smart , strong and especially has a cold temperament .you never get bored when he's in action . 
As for his friends, Erika Chiba, Leo Saijo, Yoshida Mikihiko and Mizuki Shibata have special skills, I don’t know ifit was a coincidence that Tatsuya met them but they have all something that makes them special and somehow he’s the only one who saw that unlike all other students .\n
For those of you who like the thrill it’s the perfect anime .The main character and even the supporting ones are so interesting .\n
